div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.p:
Check out this link for Mental Health resources:
https://www.facebook.com/248322268526327/posts/3954411894583994/?d=n
Reminder, starting today (April 13) food service will only be delivering on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. On Mondays and Wednesdays you will get 2 days worth of meals.

Starting tonight, April 10th, USD 224 Clifton-Clyde will be joining schools around the country by turning on our football stadium lights on Friday nights at 8:20 p.m., which is 20:20 military time, and leaving them lit for 20 minutes, and 20 seconds to honor the class of 2020. We want all community members to be aware in the event someone is wondering why our stadium lights are on.
At 8:20 p.m. on Friday nights look toward CCHS and CCMS to see the glow of our support for our graduating class of 2020.

7:30pm Zoom BOE meeting info: https://us04web.zoom.us/j/647748419?pwd=MWU4bWRXa2ZpTWNGVUNYdGx6YXF3QT09
Meeting ID: 647 748 419 Password: 806313

p.a: Event: Board of Education Meeting @ MS

h3.a: CCHS Dec. Student of the Month

div.p: Congratulations to the Clifton-Clyde High School December Student of the Month, Dillon Lee Provost!Dillon is the son of Roger and Maria Provost. Dillon has been a part of the football team for the past 3 years, lettering this past year. He has also participated in track for 2 years, lettering 1....

Quick reminder of the schedule for Friday, October 11:
--2:30pm- All schools dismissed (normal bus routes run at 2:30)
--3:00pm- Homecoming Parade downtown Clyde (moving west to east)
--Immediately following the parade: Pep rally on the downtown city lot (south of Napa)
...

h3.a: CCHS Oct. Student of the Month

div.p: Congratulations to the Clifton-Clyde High School October Student of the Month, Eric Joshua Peterson! Eric is the son of Greg and Karrie Peterson. Eric has been a part of the football team for the last 4 years, lettering for 1 year and being a captain this year. He also has played basketball for...

Below you’ll find the Continuous Learning Plan for all three buildings that has been broken up into 4 different areas and also a document that contains the whole district's plan. There are other helpful links that will be updated as we move through this Continuous Learning world of education. Thank you all for your grace and patience.

Grades Preschool through 3rd grade Click here to log into SeeSaw
Grades 4th grade through High School Click here to log into Google Classroom

div.p:
“Relationships before Rigor,
Grace before Grades,
Patience before Programs,
Love before Lessons” --Dr. Brad Johnson -Educational Speaker/Author
